definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Kenny is not good-looking, but he is very gentle.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼长得不好看，但是他很有绅士风度。

sentences.english: We visited Iowa last summer. In that neck of the woods the corn really grows tall.
sentences.chinese: 去年夏天我们访问过衣阿华州，那地方玉米长得真高。

sentences.english: She had been sitting on them for a very long time.
sentences.chinese: 难道长得丑是一种罪吗？

sentences.english: Her teeth were crooked, and she was a little overweight.
sentences.chinese: 她的牙齿长得歪歪扭扭，人也有点胖。

sentences.english: The rose in the valley is blooming so sweet.
sentences.chinese: 山谷里玫瑰花长得丰茂。
这些小海豚长得一模一样。

sentences.english: It tur out that you are Mr. Ford's son. No wonder you are the very image of him.
sentences.chinese: 原来你是福特先生的公子，怪不得长得那么象他。

sentences.english: If being ugly were a crime, you'd get the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 如果长得丑是一种罪的话，那你就应该被电刑处死。

sentences.english: Barrows grow faster because the young boars can be castrated earlier.
sentences.chinese: 由于小公猪可早一些去势，所以阉过以后长得更快。
我们都认为她长得媚人。

sentences.english: The flower plant has overgrown its support.
sentences.chinese: 盆养花长得极高，超出了支架。

sentences.english: In the second year the Fern grew more vibrant and plentiful.
sentences.chinese: 第二年羊齿长得更快更浓密。

sentences.english: He's not really good-looking, but he's attractive in a strange kind of way.
sentences.chinese: 他其实长得不算好看，但他有一种奇特的魅力。

sentences.english: He was found to have brain tumors, and they were growing fast.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋长瘤，瘤子长得很快。

sentences.english: Never get into fights with ugly people, If one day - Qzone log, they have nothing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 相对不要和长得丑的辩论，他们曾经没甚么可输的了。

definition: five sense organs of TCM (nose, eyes, lips, tongue, ears 鼻目口舌耳)/facial features
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
to resemble one another/to be alike/similar
